org.onyxplatform.api.java

Class Workflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.onyxplatform.api.java.Workflow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OnyxNames

    public final class Workflow
extends java.lang.Object
implements OnyxNames
    A workflow is the structural specification of an Onyx program. Its purpose is to articulate the paths that data flows through the cluster at runtime. It is specified via a directed, acyclic graph. The workflow representation is a vector of vectors. Each inner vector contains exactly two elements, which are keywords. The keywords represent nodes in the graph, and the vector represents a directed edge from the first node to the second.

    • Method Detail

      • addEdge

        public Workflow addEdge(java.lang.String srcTask,
                        java.lang.String dstTask)
        Adds an edge to the workflow edges content vector. An edge is a pair of strings, where the first string is the name of the independent task and the second string is the name of the dependent task. Returns the workflow so that methods can be chained.
        Parameters:
        srcTask - Source Task (Independent Edge)
        dstTask - Destination Task (Dependent Edge)
        Returns:
        the updated Workflow object

      • graph

        public clojure.lang.PersistentVector graph()
        Returns a Java array representation of the Workflow edges content vector. This method does not alter the existing PersistentVector edge container.
        Returns:
        edges contained by the workflow
